alert.note: Alert for Osage (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHERN OSAGE COUNTY THROUGH 430 PM CDT... At 400 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northeast of Pearsonia to 6 miles northwest of Fairfax. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Pawhuska... Fairfax... Shidler... Burbank... Bigheart... Osage Hills State Park... Pearsonia... Sunset Lake... Apperson... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
